chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type

Goal:
preorder partial_WO_ord

Premises:
Record preorder (A : Type) (R : relation A) : Prop := Build_preorder { preord_refl : reflexive R; preord_trans : transitive R } Arguments preorder {A}%type_scope Arguments Build_preorder {A}%type_scope
Build_preorder : forall R : relation ?A, reflexive R -> transitive R -> preorder R where ?A : [T : Type |- Type]
preord_trans = fun (A : Type) (R : relation A) (p : preorder R) => let (_, preord_trans) := p in preord_trans : forall (A : Type) (R : relation A), preorder R -> transitive R Arguments preord_trans {A}%type_scope {R}
preord_refl = fun (A : Type) (R : relation A) (p : preorder R) => let (preord_refl, _) := p in preord_refl : forall (A : Type) (R : relation A), preorder R -> reflexive R Arguments preord_refl {A}%type_scope {R}
Operators_Properties.clos_rt_is_preorder : forall (A : Type) (R : relation A), preorder (Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A R)
ZornsLemma.equivalence_Requiv : forall (T : Type) (R : relation T), preorder R -> equivalence (ZornsLemma.Requiv T R)
RingMicromega.PolEnv = fun R : Type => Env.Env R : Type -> Type Arguments RingMicromega.PolEnv _%type_scope
Ensemble = fun U : Type => U -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Ensemble _%type_scope
Env.Env = fun D : Type => BinNums.positive -> D : Type -> Type Arguments Env.Env _%type_scope
ssrbool.simpl_pred = fun T : Type => ssrfun.simpl_fun T bool : Type -> Type Arguments ssrbool.simpl_pred _%type_scope
ssrbool.pred = fun T : Type => T -> bool : Type -> Type Arguments ssrbool.pred _%type_scope
relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
Relations_1.Relation = fun U : Type => U -> U -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relations_1.Relation _%type_scope
ZornsLemmaForPreorders : forall (T : Type) (R : relation T), preorder R -> (forall S : Ensemble T, chain R S -> exists x : T, forall y : T, In S y -> R y x) -> exists x : T, premaximal R x
ChoiceFacts.OmniscientFunctionalChoice_on = fun A B : Type => forall R : A -> B -> Prop, inhabited B -> exists f : A -> B, forall x : A, (exists y : B, R x y) -> R x (f x) : Type -> Type -> Prop Arguments ChoiceFacts.OmniscientFunctionalChoice_on (_ _)%type_scope
ChoiceFacts.FunctionalChoice_on = fun A B : Type => forall R : A -> B -> Prop, (forall x : A, exists y : B, R x y) -> exists f : A -> B, forall x : A, R x (f x) : Type -> Type -> Prop Arguments ChoiceFacts.FunctionalChoice_on (_ _)%type_scope
Quotients.quotient : forall A : Type, relation A -> Type
Fin.depair_sanity : forall (o : Fin.t ?m) (p : Fin.t ?n), proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat (Fin.depair o p)) = ?n * proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat o) + proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat p) where ?m : [T : Type |- nat] ?n : [T : Type |- nat]
Fin.R : forall n : nat, Fin.t ?m -> Fin.t (n + ?m) where ?m : [T : Type |- nat]
Variant mem_pred (T : Type) : Type := Mem : ssrbool.pred T -> ssrbool.mem_pred T Arguments ssrbool.mem_pred _%type_scope Arguments ssrbool.Mem [T]%type_scope
Fin.L : forall n : nat, Fin.t ?m -> Fin.t (?m + n) where ?m : [T : Type |- nat]
Extensionality_Ensembles : forall A B : Ensemble ?U, Same_set A B -> A = B where ?U : [T : Type |- Type]
intro_characteristic_sat : forall (P : ?X -> Prop) (x : ?X), P x -> In (characteristic_function_abstraction P) x where ?X : [T : Type |- Type]
Build_equivalence : forall R : relation ?A, reflexive R -> transitive R -> symmetric R -> equivalence R where ?A : [T : Type |- Type]
Build_order : forall R : relation ?A, reflexive R -> transitive R -> antisymmetric R -> order R where ?A : [T : Type |- Type]
Fin.L_sanity : forall (n : nat) (p : Fin.t ?m), proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat (Fin.L n p)) = proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat p) where ?m : [T : Type |- nat]
Fin.R_sanity : forall (n : nat) (p : Fin.t ?m), proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat (Fin.R n p)) = n + proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat p) where ?m : [T : Type |- nat]
Record manifest_simpl_pred (T : Type) (p : ssrbool.pred T) : Type := ManifestSimplPred { simpl_pred_value : ssrbool.simpl_pred T; _ : simpl_pred_value = ssrbool.SimplPred p } Arguments ssrbool.manifest_simpl_pred [T]%type_scope Arguments ssrbool.ManifestSimplPred [T]%type_scope [p simpl_pred_value]
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Record partial_WO : Type := Build_partial_WO { pwo_S : Ensemble T; pwo_R : relation T; pwo_R_lives_on_S : forall x y : T, pwo_R x y -> In pwo_S x /\ In pwo_S y; pwo_wo : well_order (restriction_relation pwo_R pwo_S) } Arguments Build_partial_WO _ _ _%function_scope
Record InjTyp (S T : Type) : Type := mkinj { inj : S -> T; pred : T -> Prop; cstr : forall x : S, pred (inj x) } InjTyp has primitive projections with eta conversion. Arguments ZifyClasses.InjTyp (_ _)%type_scope Arguments ZifyClasses.mkinj (_ _)%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope

```coq
Definition preorder_partial_WO_ord : preorder (partial_WO_ord).
Proof.
intro p.
unfold partial_WO_ord in p.
destruct p as [pwo_S pwo_R pwo_R_lives_on_S pwo_wo].
assert (refl : reflexive (restriction_relation pwo_R pwo_S)).
{ intro x.
split.
left.
apply pwo_R_lives_on_S.
split; eauto.
}
assert (trans : transitive (restriction_relation pwo_R pwo_S)).
{ intros x y z.
split.
apply pwo_R_lives_on_S.
split; eauto.
}
exists (Build_preorder (restriction_relation pwo_R pwo_S) refl trans).
reflexivity.
Defined.
Qed.
